trans-unit.source: Configure CHAP for your StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure CHAP for your StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to configure the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) on a StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to configure the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) on a StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Configure CHAP for your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Configure CHAP for your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to configure CHAP for your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to configure CHAP for your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: CHAP stands for Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol.
trans-unit.target: CHAP stands for Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol.

trans-unit.source: It is an authentication scheme used by servers to validate the identity of remote clients.
trans-unit.target: It is an authentication scheme used by servers to validate the identity of remote clients.

trans-unit.source: The verification is based on a shared password or secret.
trans-unit.target: The verification is based on a shared password or secret.

trans-unit.source: CHAP can be one-way (unidirectional) or mutual (bidirectional).
trans-unit.target: CHAP can be one-way (unidirectional) or mutual (bidirectional).

trans-unit.source: One-way CHAP is when the target authenticates an initiator.
trans-unit.target: One-way CHAP is when the target authenticates an initiator.

trans-unit.source: Mutual or reverse CHAP, on the other hand, requires that the target authenticate the initiator and then the initiator authenticate the target.
trans-unit.target: Mutual or reverse CHAP, on the other hand, requires that the target authenticate the initiator and then the initiator authenticate the target.

trans-unit.source: Initiator authentication can be implemented without target authentication.
trans-unit.target: Initiator authentication can be implemented without target authentication.

trans-unit.source: However, target authentication can be implemented only if initiator authentication is also implemented.
trans-unit.target: However, target authentication can be implemented only if initiator authentication is also implemented.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, we recommend that you use CHAP to enhance iSCSI security.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, we recommend that you use CHAP to enhance iSCSI security.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Keep in mind that IPSEC is not currently supported on StorSimple devices.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Keep in mind that IPSEC is not currently supported on StorSimple devices.

trans-unit.source: The CHAP settings on the StorSimple device can be configured in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: The CHAP settings on the StorSimple device can be configured in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: Unidirectional or one-way authentication
trans-unit.target: Unidirectional or one-way authentication

trans-unit.source: Bidirectional or mutual or reverse authentication
trans-unit.target: Bidirectional or mutual or reverse authentication

trans-unit.source: In each of these cases, the device Management Portal and the server iSCSI initiator software need to be configured.
trans-unit.target: In each of these cases, the device Management Portal and the server iSCSI initiator software need to be configured.

trans-unit.source: The detailed steps for this configuration are described in the following tutorial.
trans-unit.target: The detailed steps for this configuration are described in the following tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Unidirectional or one-way authentication
trans-unit.target: Unidirectional or one-way authentication

trans-unit.source: In unidirectional authentication, the target authenticates the initiator.
trans-unit.target: In unidirectional authentication, the target authenticates the initiator.

trans-unit.source: This authentication requires that you configure the CHAP initiator settings on the StorSimple device and the iSCSI Initiator software on the host.
trans-unit.target: This authentication requires that you configure the CHAP initiator settings on the StorSimple device and the iSCSI Initiator software on the host.

trans-unit.source: The detailed procedures for your StorSimple device and Windows host are described next.
trans-unit.target: The detailed procedures for your StorSimple device and Windows host are described next.

trans-unit.source: To configure your device for one-way authentication
trans-unit.target: To configure your device for one-way authentication

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, on the **Devices** page, click the **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, on the **Devices** page, click the **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: CHAP Initiator
trans-unit.target: CHAP Initiator

trans-unit.source: Scroll down on this page, and in the **CHAP Initiator** section:
trans-unit.target: Scroll down on this page, and in the **CHAP Initiator** section:

trans-unit.source: Provide a user name for your CHAP initiator.
trans-unit.target: Provide a user name for your CHAP initiator.

trans-unit.source: Supply a password for your CHAP initiator.
trans-unit.target: Supply a password for your CHAP initiator.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The CHAP user name must contain fewer than 233 characters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The CHAP user name must contain fewer than 233 characters.

trans-unit.source: The CHAP password must be between 12 and 16 characters.
trans-unit.target: The CHAP password must be between 12 and 16 characters.

trans-unit.source: A longer user name or password will result in an authentication failure on the Windows host.
trans-unit.target: A longer user name or password will result in an authentication failure on the Windows host.

trans-unit.source: To configure one-way authentication on the Windows host server
trans-unit.target: To configure one-way authentication on the Windows host server

trans-unit.source: On the Windows host server, start the iSCSI Initiator.
trans-unit.target: On the Windows host server, start the iSCSI Initiator.

trans-unit.source: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Click the **Discovery** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Discovery** tab.

trans-unit.source: iSCSI initiator properties
trans-unit.target: iSCSI initiator properties

trans-unit.source: Click **Discover Portal**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Discover Portal**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Discover Target Portal** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Discover Target Portal** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Specify the IP address of your device.
trans-unit.target: Specify the IP address of your device.

trans-unit.source: Click **Advanced**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Advanced**.

trans-unit.source: Discover target portal
trans-unit.target: Discover target portal

trans-unit.source: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Select the **Enable CHAP log on** check box.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Enable CHAP log on** check box.

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** field, supply the user name that you specified for the CHAP Initiator in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** field, supply the user name that you specified for the CHAP Initiator in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the **Target secret** field, supply the password that you specified for the CHAP Initiator in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: In the **Target secret** field, supply the password that you specified for the CHAP Initiator in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Advanceds settings general
trans-unit.target: Advanceds settings general

trans-unit.source: On the **Targets** tab of the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, the device status should appear as **Connected**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Targets** tab of the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, the device status should appear as **Connected**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you change the iSCSI name, the new name will be used for new iSCSI sessions.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you change the iSCSI name, the new name will be used for new iSCSI sessions.

trans-unit.source: New settings are not used for existing sessions until you log off and log on again.
trans-unit.target: New settings are not used for existing sessions until you log off and log on again.

trans-unit.source: For more information about configuring CHAP on the Windows host server, go to [Additional considerations](#additional-considerations).
trans-unit.target: For more information about configuring CHAP on the Windows host server, go to [Additional considerations](#additional-considerations).

trans-unit.source: Bidirectional or mutual authentication
trans-unit.target: Bidirectional or mutual authentication

trans-unit.source: In bidirectional authentication, the target authenticates the initiator and then the initiator authenticates the target.
trans-unit.target: In bidirectional authentication, the target authenticates the initiator and then the initiator authenticates the target.

trans-unit.source: This requires the user to configure the CHAP initiator settings, as well as the reverse CHAP settings on the device and iSCSI Initiator software on the host.
trans-unit.target: This requires the user to configure the CHAP initiator settings, as well as the reverse CHAP settings on the device and iSCSI Initiator software on the host.

trans-unit.source: The following procedures describe the steps to configure mutual authentication on the device and on the Windows host.
trans-unit.target: The following procedures describe the steps to configure mutual authentication on the device and on the Windows host.

trans-unit.source: To configure your device for mutual authentication
trans-unit.target: To configure your device for mutual authentication

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, on the **Devices** page, click the **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, on the **Devices** page, click the **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: CHAP target
trans-unit.target: CHAP target

trans-unit.source: Scroll down on this page, and in the **CHAP Target** section:
trans-unit.target: Scroll down on this page, and in the **CHAP Target** section:

trans-unit.source: Provide a **Reverse CHAP user name** for your device.
trans-unit.target: Provide a **Reverse CHAP user name** for your device.

trans-unit.source: Supply a **Reverse CHAP password** for your device.
trans-unit.target: Supply a **Reverse CHAP password** for your device.

trans-unit.source: Confirm the password.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the password.

trans-unit.source: In the **CHAP Initiator** section:
trans-unit.target: In the **CHAP Initiator** section:

trans-unit.source: Provide a **user name** for your device.
trans-unit.target: Provide a **user name** for your device.

trans-unit.source: Provide a **password** for your device.
trans-unit.target: Provide a **password** for your device.

trans-unit.source: Confirm the password.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the password.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: A confirmation message will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: A confirmation message will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to save the changes.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to save the changes.

trans-unit.source: To configure bidirectional authentication on the Windows host server
trans-unit.target: To configure bidirectional authentication on the Windows host server

trans-unit.source: On the Windows host server, start the iSCSI Initiator.
trans-unit.target: On the Windows host server, start the iSCSI Initiator.

trans-unit.source: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, click the **Configuration** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, click the **Configuration** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **CHAP**.
trans-unit.target: Click **CHAP**.

trans-unit.source: In the **iSCSI Initiator Mutual CHAP Secret** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **iSCSI Initiator Mutual CHAP Secret** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Type the **Reverse CHAP Password** that you configured in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Type the **Reverse CHAP Password** that you configured in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: iSCSI initiator mutual CHAP secret
trans-unit.target: iSCSI initiator mutual CHAP secret

trans-unit.source: Click the **Targets** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Targets** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Connect** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Connect** button.

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect To Target** dialog box, click **Advanced**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect To Target** dialog box, click **Advanced**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Advanced Properties** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Advanced Properties** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Select the **Enable CHAP log on** check box.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Enable CHAP log on** check box.

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** field, supply the user name that you specified for the CHAP Initiator in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** field, supply the user name that you specified for the CHAP Initiator in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the **Target secret** field, supply the password that you specified for the CHAP Initiator in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: In the **Target secret** field, supply the password that you specified for the CHAP Initiator in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Perform mutual authentication** check box.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Perform mutual authentication** check box.

trans-unit.source: Advanceds settings mutual authentication
trans-unit.target: Advanceds settings mutual authentication

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to complete the CHAP configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to complete the CHAP configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information about configuring CHAP on the Windows host server, go to [Additional considerations](#additional-considerations).
trans-unit.target: For more information about configuring CHAP on the Windows host server, go to [Additional considerations](#additional-considerations).

trans-unit.source: Additional considerations
trans-unit.target: Additional considerations

trans-unit.source: The **Quick Connect** feature does not support connections that have CHAP enabled.
trans-unit.target: The **Quick Connect** feature does not support connections that have CHAP enabled.

trans-unit.source: When CHAP is enabled, make sure that you use the **Connect** button that is available on the **Targets** tab to connect to a target.
trans-unit.target: When CHAP is enabled, make sure that you use the **Connect** button that is available on the **Targets** tab to connect to a target.

trans-unit.source: Connect to target
trans-unit.target: Connect to target

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box that is presented, select the **Add this connection to the list of Favorite Targets** check box.
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box that is presented, select the **Add this connection to the list of Favorite Targets** check box.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that every time the computer restarts, an attempt is made to restore the connection to the iSCSI favorite targets.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that every time the computer restarts, an attempt is made to restore the connection to the iSCSI favorite targets.

trans-unit.source: Errors during configuration
trans-unit.target: Errors during configuration

trans-unit.source: If your CHAP configuration is incorrect, then you are likely to see an **Authentication failure** error message.
trans-unit.target: If your CHAP configuration is incorrect, then you are likely to see an **Authentication failure** error message.

trans-unit.source: Verification of CHAP configuration
trans-unit.target: Verification of CHAP configuration

trans-unit.source: You can verify that CHAP is being used by completing the following steps.
trans-unit.target: You can verify that CHAP is being used by completing the following steps.

trans-unit.source: To verify your CHAP configuration
trans-unit.target: To verify your CHAP configuration

trans-unit.source: Click **Favorite Targets**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Favorite Targets**.

trans-unit.source: Select the target for which you enabled authentication.
trans-unit.target: Select the target for which you enabled authentication.

trans-unit.source: Click **Details**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Details**.

trans-unit.source: iSCSI initiator properties favorite targets
trans-unit.target: iSCSI initiator properties favorite targets

trans-unit.source: In the **Favorite Target Details** dialog box, note the entry in the **Authentication** field.
trans-unit.target: In the **Favorite Target Details** dialog box, note the entry in the **Authentication** field.

trans-unit.source: If the configuration was successful, it should say **CHAP**.
trans-unit.target: If the configuration was successful, it should say **CHAP**.

trans-unit.source: Favorite target details
trans-unit.target: Favorite target details

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [StorSimple security](storsimple-security.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [StorSimple security](storsimple-security.md).
